item.title: MathTime!
item.description: For the last few weeks my family is up to our ears in maths exercises and brain teasers as my daughter has developed a big interest. I am setting up a “newsletter” for puzzles. Once in a few days I would send a few exercises. Readers can send their solutions if they want, and I will mark them. This would cost a few pounds per month. To sign up, email to mathtime@autkin.

item.title: Finger-counting
item.description: Today during family dinner my kiddo started finger-counting. I shared what I knew about a less popular system which allows counting to 12 on one hand: Finger-counting systems in use in many regions of Asia allow for counting to 12 by using a single hand. The thumb acts as a pointer touching the three finger bones of each finger in turn, starting with the outermost bone of the little finger. One hand is used to count numbers up to 12.
